content:
well direct truth is just what you experience all the time
self-realization is the end of confusing thinking with the direct truth (direct experience)

you can only know truth in relationship to your own direct sensory perception
experience itself without interpretation is truth
this is what jk means by "truth is a pathless land", since thinking can never lead to that type of direct *truth*
to be fair this is a very panpsychist worldview which sees everything only in relationship with conscious experience

alright its done! but quite rushed and probably not high quality. would be interested in what @jamie0773 has to say about how i defined the terms
if anyone has questions or objections ping me and let me know

Observation - the fact of content appearing in awareness
Interpretation - a narrative created by thinking to describe a past event. an incorrect use of interpretation is what leads to the self-image which is often described as "experiencing things twice" (once as the event, another time as the interpretation)
Guilt - the belief that one has caused unnecessary suffering, which encourages the mind to learn to not cause unnecessary suffering (not necessarily tied to self-image)
Shame - the belief that one is insufficient (tied to self-image)
Annoyance - the belief that ones current experience could extremely conceivably be better if some process was more efficient (necessarily tied to self-image since it stems from a failure to recognize the one-ness of experience)
Frustration - the belief that efforts are not leading to the intended results (not necessarily tied to self-image)
Physical Time/Calendar Time - the sequential passage of events that is not directly experienced
Intelligence - the ability to recognize and correct errors in thinking

I think my dictionary is going to end very different from jamie's because im a panpsychist and jamie seems to be either a dualist or a materialist. also dictionary kinda sucks ngl i think ive done a bad job lol

Belief - a truth claim about the world which one believes to be true
Facts - a truth claim which accurately describes sense perception, both in the content and the literal relationship between thoughts and the 5 main senses
Knowledge - memory (which makes "self-knowledge" "self-memory", which is an oxymoron)
Self image - what one believes oneself to be, which are inherently emotional due to the nature of self-belief
Sensory Perception - conscious experience occurring now
Past - events which happened previously, but only are subjectively experienced as a thought now (never truly experienced)
Future - events which are expected to happen, but are only subjectively experienced as a thought now (never truly experienced)
Reality - the existence of sensory perception (this is a panpsychist worldview, jamie might say "physical reality")
Emotions - physical sensations in the body that are internally generated by evaluating sensory perception or thinking
Happiness - the **default **mode of experience where one has no negative beliefs about onself that are currently operating (taken straight from jamie)
Anger - the belief that something has wronged you (taken straight from jamie)
Love - present oneness of experience which facilitates naturally caring and altruistic behavior (honestly not sure about this one)
Good - evaluating one scenario to be favorable to another (which necessarily stems from not recognizing the one-ness of experience, so there is nothing to compare in the first place)
Bad - evaluating one scenario to be less favorable to another (which necessarily stems from not recognizing the one-ness of experience, so there is nothing to compare in the first place)
Like - good in terms of a sensory experience
Dislike - bad in terms of a sensory experience
ill give it a shot give me a few hours or so and ill get back to you once i have a bigger free chunk of time
these look hard to define lol
